question: Choosing k > 25 for kNN might seem unusually high. Based on the Iris dataset, which of the following are reasonable explanations for why this could still result in good performance?

answers.answer: Setosa is linearly separable and clearly distinct from the other two classes.
The dataset is relatively noise-free, making predictions from a large neighborhood more stable.
A high k-value leads to a highly flexible model that fits the data very closely.
Versicolor and Virginica are perfectly separable, so k has no influence on classification accuracy.
